page.title: 11Work on a typical local farm
page.content: I live on a typical mixed farm in the area.We have 400 ewes,30 rams and 50 cattle.We grow 8 acres of corn. Two workers are employed on the farm and they start work at 7.30a.m. and finish at about 6.00p.m..In the Spring, at lambing time, the men work in shifts,with 1 working during the day, and 1 at night.The fattened lambs and calves are sold at either Hereford or Ross Market in the Autumn. Shearing in late Spring normally takes a week and uses a lot of labour who work long hours.Some farms hire contractors to do the shearing.Feeding the animals is expensive and many farmers make silage to save costs.Hay and silage making take up much of the summer months.Then the land is ploughed and resown. The modern farmer must be cost effective and work hard to succeed.
